io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities.Position

  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    The position keeps state of all Pieces on board. It associates each Vertex of the board (i.e. a square, such as 'e4') with the piece being on it (or null if the square is empty).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String POSITION_SERIALIZATION_SEPARATOR
      The separator character to be used to delimit squares in the string representation of a position: ";".

    • Field Detail

      • POSITION_SERIALIZATION_SEPARATOR

        public static final java.lang.String POSITION_SERIALIZATION_SEPARATOR
        The separator character to be used to delimit squares in the string representation of a position: ";". See the deserialize(String) method for an explanation of the serialized text format.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position()
        Creates a position. By default, the position is empty - use the init() if you want to populate a standard starting position.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all pieces from the board.

      • init

        public void init()
        Sets up a starting position, positioning the pieces according to traditional chess rules. Subclasses could define another set of starting pieces if needed.

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(Vertex vertex,
            Piece piece)
        Positions a piece on a given vertex. This is not a move - the piece will simply go on a square, replacing any existing piece.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The target square.
        piece - The new piece.

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece(Vertex vertex)
        Retrieves the piece from a given square.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The target square.
        Returns:
        The piece located on the vertex, or null if the vertex is empty, missing or invalid.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        A position equals another if it has the same disposition of pieces.

      • serialize

        public static java.lang.String serialize(Position position)
        Transforms a position object into a string representation of the position.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The string representation of the position.

      • deserialize

        public static Position deserialize(java.lang.String representation)
                            throws InvalidPositionException
        Builds a position object from a string representation. The representation lists the content of each square of the board, starting from the top left (a8) and ending to the bottom right (h1), the content being the piece string representation, or the empty string. Each square is separated by the ";". Example: BR;BN;BB;...WB;WN;WR.
        Parameters:
        representation - The string representation of a position.
        Returns:
        A position object.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - When the position cannot be built from the passed representation.
